item.title: Quantum versus Avalanche Breakdown Randomness
item.description: Avalanche breakdown and quantum are two methods for generating true random numbers. Here, we’ll compare them for feasibility and quality. The feasibility of a TRNG is how many bits per second it can produce while remaining random. And that leads us into quality which will be determined according to the NIST’s STS.

item.title: Custom Gates in Qiskit with Pulse
item.description: Quantum research often requires applying operations in novel ways; however, it’s occasionally necessary to create gates to reduce circuit length. If too many operations are applied to a qubit, the quantum state is lost and no valuable insight can be gained.

item.title: Quantum Tales
item.description: Shortly after becoming an IBM Qiskit Advocate, I was introduced to the Unitary Fund. After writing a story where the reader uses Shor’s algorithm to decrypt a stock listing, I wanted to create more stories teaching quantum algorithms. With the help of the Unitary Fund, I was able to realize this dream.
